Class Endpoint

java.lang.Object
com.example.esamepo.controller.Endpoint
@RestController
public class Endpoint
extends java.lang.Object
Controller class for handling all the rest API route

      public Endpoint()

  • Method Details

    • listAll

      @GetMapping("/listAll") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.ArrayList<TldName>> listAll()
      route that show all the Tld name as a response of a GET request. because of the temporary downtime of the https://api.domainsdb.info/v1/info/tld/ API tlds.json has been created as a workaround, it contains 100 randomly selected top-level domain, that have been checked to be available in Domains-Index database.
      Returns:
      a json array of TldName containing all the Tlds Names
      Throws:
      ServerException - exception launched is something went wrong with https://api.domainsdb.info/v1/info/tld/

    • rank

      @GetMapping("/rank") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.ArrayList<TldDescription>> rank​(@RequestParam(name="count",required=false,defaultValue="10") int count)
      route that show a list of tlds, ordered by the number of domains contained, as a response of a get request
      Parameters:
      count - number of tlds to fetch, 10 by default, because the api is slow is better to maintain this number small
      Returns:
      return a json array of TldDescription, showing the name of the tld and the count of the domains contained, ordered by this count
      Throws:
      ServerException - exception launched if something went wrong with https://api.domainsdb.info/v1/info/stat/
      UserException - exception launched if the user input is not a positive integer

    • wordStats

      @PostMapping(path="/stats", consumes="application/json", produces="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.ArrayList<WordUsage>> wordStats​(@RequestBody java.lang.String data)
      route that show the number of times that the words, passed as post request body, are part of the domain names in a specified tld
      Parameters:
      data - json formatted string that contains the Tld name and the words to search. json body schema: { "tld":"string", "words":["string"] }
      Returns:
      return a json array of WordUsage indicating the domain, the word and the number of matches, ordered by this number
      Throws:
      ServerException - exception launched if something went wrong with https://api.domainsdb.info/v1/info/stat/
      UserException - exception launched if the user put an invalid tld name as input

    • info

      @GetMapping("/info") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<TldDescription> info​(@RequestParam(name="tld",defaultValue="null") java.lang.String tld)
      route that show relevant information about a tld from a get request
      Parameters:
      tld - the name of the tld
      Returns:
      return a json serialized TldDescription with the tld name, the count of the domains and the description.
      Throws:
      ServerException - exception launched if something went wrong with https://api.domainsdb.info/v1/info/tld/
      UserException - exception launched if the user put an invalid tld name as input

    • statistic

      @GetMapping("/stats") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<TldStats> statistic​(@RequestParam(name="count",required=false,defaultValue="10") int count)
      route that show statistics about domains contained in the tlds.
      Parameters:
      count - number of tlds to fetch, 10 by default, because the api is slow is better to maintain this number small
      Returns:
      json serialization of TldStats containing the tld with the minimum number of domains, the tld with the maximum number of domains and the average of domains contained in the fetched tld
      Throws:
      UserException - exception launched if the user input is not a positive integer
